comment: When I submitted an essay on religion he gave it a 90 despite it only having two grammatical mistakes. I later found out his personal beliefs were different than my own through a staff member. He told me one time “your French isn't good enough”. I'm' speaking French for a huge European company now so I guess he was wrong!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Lots of work, lots of readings, not much of a helper when struggling. The guy is nice but so boring. Coming from other French classes, this prof is definitely below average when it comes to teaching. Unless you absolutely have to take him, I would avoid.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Every week was chapter, lecture, quiz, discussion, activity (usually questions from the book &/or phonetic transcription). Very heavy workload and very difficult material. Prof is nice, accessible outside class, knowledgeable. When I was struggling, he didn't have much to offer in the way of help, other than to answer any specific questions I had.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: will definitely make you work for your grade but does so in a way that you understand what youre doing & it isnt just busy work. hes also very accessible outside class if you dont understand & will work with you if you show initiative. dont take if you have a full courseload otherwise bc he assigns a lot of work, but a great choice otherwise.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Easily my favorite French professor. Dr. Leger is a great teacher and a kind person. If you put in effort, he will notice and appreciate it. Sometimes there's a lot of work, but you'll learn a lot in his class!

LOVE this professor. He'll push you, but he cares about his students and just wants you to come out of his class having learned a lot. He's super- helpful and does a great job breaking the French language down. In my opinion, he is the best French professor at KSU. I will miss him!

Good professor. But beware; he expects A LOT from his students. If he doesn't tell you you're doing great, don't worry; that's his way of pushing you. But he makes it fun and your French will get much better as a result. Go to class!!!!!
I took this class for fun - and yes, it was fun. Dr. Leger is a great teacher - very animated and interactive. Plus, I met my fiance in his class!
Definitely one of the best French teachers I have ever had.
